subject: Parenting
title: The Peer Effect on Decisions
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Peer Effect on Decisions.

hook.text: A teen drives safely alone. Add two friends to the car and crash risk triples.

buildup.text: Peer presence activates the brain's reward centers, making risky choices feel more appealing.

discovery.text: Brain scans show the ventral striatum lights up more in teens when peers are watching.

twist.text: Peers don't even have to say anything. Just being observed changes the brain's calculations.

climax.text: This peer effect peaks around age 14 and fades significantly by the early twenties.

quiz.question: What happens to teen crash risk when two peers are in the car?
